name: heat production, straw, organic, at furnace 300kW | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19887/documentation

Production of heat by burning straw, organic, in a  furnace of 300kw capacity for heat production. The infrastructure, and the electricity inputs were obtained from the dataset wood chips, hard wood,  burned in furnace 300kw. The emissions were obtained from literature.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - treatment of straw, organic, in furnace 300kW, GLO, 1983 - 2007 (3b03fe9c-c88a-41fa-8246-b0385863fbd7)]

From reception of straw, organic at the furnace

This module describes the combustion of straw, organic. Included are the infrastructure, the straw requirements , the emissions to air, the electricity needed for operation, and the disposal of the ashes.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: from oldest to newest publication date of litarature sources
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: based on geography of production of straw from barley,  rye and wheat.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: based on technology from wood chips burning dataset and several studies with experimental burning in different furnaces.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data on emissions are extrapolated from a power plant using straw as an energy source and from several experimental studies found in literature review. Due to a lack of specific emissions for organic straw, these are obtained from data on emissions for regular straw burning.

exchanges.description: Calculation based on furnace calorific efficiency (82%) )and low calorific value of straw (15MJ/kg dry mass)

flow.name: heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

exchanges.description:
Based on experimental study. Average emission factor (mg/kg dry fuel) for several herbacious fuels (rice, wheat, barley straws; corn stover and sugarcane trash). 

The study reports elemental and water soluble species concentrations and emissions factors obtained from particulate matter collected during test burns. The tests were conducted in a combustion wind tunnel at the University of California, Davis.

The emission factor of aluminium is 5.6

Based on experimental study. Average emission factor (mg/kg dry fuel) for several herbacious fuels (rice, wheat, barley straws; corn stover and sugarcane trash).  

The study reports elemental and water soluble species concentrations and emissions factors obtained from particulate matter collected during test burns. The tests were conducted in a combustion wind tunnel at the University of California, Davis.

The emission factor of phosphorous is 29
910 g of CO  are produced per 1 ton of straw burned.(http://www.lcafood.dk/processes/energyconversion/heatandpowerfromstraw.htm)

exchanges.description:
Based on experimental study. Average emission factor (mg/kg dry fuel) for several herbacious fuels (rice, wheat, barley straws; corn stover and sugarcane trash). 

The study reports elemental and water soluble species concentrations and emissions factors obtained from particulate matter collected during test burns. The tests were conducted in a combustion wind tunnel at the University of California, Davis.

The emission factor of chromium is 0.093
due to lack of process specific emission data, it has been adapted  from the emission factor (kg/MJ input) given for the combustion of mixed wood chips in a cogen 300KW.

Based on average of 5 tests on straw burning. In each test, there has been a chemical analysis for formaldehyde due to emissions from straw incineration, expressed as mg/kg dry fuel burned.
The burning process took place in a commercial stoker-fed trough-burning furnace  with a minimum heat output of 75kW. In this study straw from barley was used as a fuel.

EcoSpold01Location=CH
general assumption, obtained from dataset "wood chips burned in furnace, 300kW". It is assumed that wood-chips furnace needs energy inputs in the order of 1.5% of the fuel energy input.
The conversion from MJ to Kwh is 3.6kWh/MJ

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
The data refer to heat and power production at Masnedo heat and power plant (Denmark) in 1999. The plant is dimensioned to 10MW electricity and 23 MJ heat/sec and is primarily fired with straw (about 400000 t/year).
Data on slag/ash generation have been derived from the plant's green account in 2002 (from 1999, where input from other biomass than straw was relatifvely low - 10% in terms of mass). As an approximation, all biomass entering the plant has been considered as straw. Data on emissions to air have been determined from emission factors (Gasteknisk Center, 2003). 

8.3 kg of ash are produced per 1 ton of straw burned.

due to lack of process specific emission data, it has been adapted  from the emission factor (kg/MJ input) given for the combustion of mixed wood chips in a cogen 300KW.

54 kg of slag are produced per 1 ton of straw burned. The slag is returned to farmland (Nielsen, 2004).This flow is expressed as phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5 and nitrogen fertiliser, as N. 

The slag produced during straw combustion contains 0,8-2.1% P2O5 and 0,05-0,08% N . (http://www.lcafood.dk/processes/energyconversion/heatandpowerfromstraw.htm)
The average values are used for this inventory.
